alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 1:48PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following counties, far northern Pima and southwest Pinal. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Rosa Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Komelik and Kohatk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
